summary: This document appears to be a log or index of electronic file transfer artifacts (EFTA), containing references to text messages (SMS) from May-June 2020. The messages mention Mark Epstein and Jeffrey Epstein, indicating communication about updates on Jeffrey Epstein's situation.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: His cell phone number is listed, and a message indicates he will be in the office and can provide an update on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in a text message as the subject for which an update is to be provided.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is communicating about providing an update on Jeffrey Epstein's situation.

events.title: Message about office and Epstein update
events.description: A text message indicates Mark Epstein will be in the office and can provide an update on Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Frustrated email about Epstein
events.description: A text message references a sent long email expressing frustration with 'Epstein nonsense'.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein's cell phone number (917 543 2432) is recorded in the document.
Text messages from May-June 2020 discuss providing updates on Jeffrey Epstein's situation.
A message from June 27, 2020, references a 'long email' and frustration with 'Epstein nonsense'.
The document is a log of electronic file transfer artifacts (EFTA), suggesting it is part of a larger collection of digital evidence.
The communications occur after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating ongoing discussions or investigations related to him.
